page.title: 02LANDSCAPE: The River Irwell
page.content: The Irwell is 300 million years old it starts as a spring in a hillside at Irwell farm on the A671 road.It is a fairly short river,only 39 miles in length.Until the 19th century the fishing industry was prosperous.The 19th century population and industry grew.Many factories poured their waste products directly into the river.All fish life was wiped out and because of the dreadful state of the river the first river prevention act was passed in 1876. During the years the Irwell has improved, mainly due to less trade premises disposing of their waste into the river.There are also improvments of the quality of the treated effluent effluents that leaves the sewage works Drinking water is not taken from The Irwell, but 72.1 mgl a day are licensed for the public from 39 res.
